articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
This year has brought a number of significant changes with it, probably to no surprise of most people in the United States. The largest change was undoubtedly in the political arena. The effects of the change of politics in America is ripe for discussion as for how it has changed the business environment all around…
The post Adopt a ‘Three Bear Strategy’ appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Adopt a ‘Three Bear Strategy’

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
In Fans First, Jesse Cole—founder of the Savannah Bananas baseball team and its signature yellow tuxedo—delivers more than a book; he delivers a manifesto on reimagining customer experience. With unfiltered enthusiasm and a flair for the unconventional, Cole offers a powerful reminder that fan obsession—not industry norms—should drive business strategy. At first glance, the story…
The post Book Review: Fans First: Change the Game, Break the Rules & Create an Unforgettable Experience by Jesse Cole appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Book Review: Fans First: Change the Game, Break the Rules & Create an Unforgettable Experience by Jesse Cole

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
By John M. Love, Joanie Keller-Hand, Lynn Ransford, Lisa Verner, and Paula Hyatt1 When Melinda Carver (not her real name) finally found a job with a Jackson County business after months of looking, she faced a serious dilemma: who would care for her 2-year-old daughter and 4-year-old son. As a single parent, Melinda had little…
The post Business and Childcare: A Crucial Symbiosis appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Business and Childcare: A Crucial Symbiosis

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County proclaimed June 1–8 as Nurse Appreciation Week, honoring the dedication of local nurses. Aviva Health nurses joined a celebration at the county building, with thanks to Commissioners Freeman, Kress, and Boice for recognizing their vital role in the community.
articles.title: Douglas County Proclaims Nurse Appreciation Week, Honoring Local Heroes

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: June 5, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Two men were found injured and uncooperative in a truck after a reported fight and gunshot on Melqua Rd. Deputies, negotiators, and the DCSO Tactical Team responded. A K-9 was used to apprehend one man. Two guns were found; charges are pending. Both were hospitalized for injuries.
articles.title: Douglas County Sheriff's Office Tactical Response, Crisis Negotiation Teams Called to Disturbance

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston’s 4th of July fireworks are officially back on for their 5th year! Thanks to community support and the WAID team, the celebration will light up the sky once again. A community meeting is set for June 5 at 6 PM at Riverbend Park. All are welcome to join and get involved.
articles.title: Winston’s Fourth of July Fireworks Are Officially Back On

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: June 4, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Fire season for the Douglas District begins Friday, June 6, 2025 at 12:01 AM. DFPA has set public use restrictions to Moderate and IFPL to Level I. The declaration applies to all private, state, federal, and BIA lands in the district. Fire safety rules are now in effect to help prevent wildfires.
articles.title: DFPA Declares Start of 2025 Fire Season for Douglas District

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A wind-driven grass fire northwest of Roseburg burned 6.5 acres Monday afternoon. Crews from multiple agencies stopped the fire’s spread. Officials urge residents to take precautions when using powered equipment near dry vegetation as fire season approaches.
articles.title: Wind-Driven Grass Fire Burns Over 6 Acres Northwest of Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A crash on NW Stewart Parkway Saturday night claimed the life of 19-year-old motorcyclist Zevin Alvarez. Roseburg Police say the driver of a car admitted to running a red light. The investigation remains ongoing.
articles.title: Crash Claims Life of 19-Year-Old Motorcyclist in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A fire in the attic of a Green home Monday displaced several adults, children, and pets. Crews from CDF&R and partner agencies contained the fire in 20 minutes. The likely cause was a discarded cigarette. The American Red Cross is assisting the displaced family.
articles.title: Attic Fire Displaces Family in Green on Monday Afternoon
